page.title: 03The Village Green, Aldridge
page.content: Our Village Green was originally called Hall Croft and was part of the farm land belonging to the Manor House Farm. In the late 1940's the council purchased this farm land and public festivities such as bonfires were held on it although Manor Farm still rented it as grazing land. In the 1950's{The {Croft}finally became our Village Green. Between 1972 and 1976 local people fought to save{The Croft}from being used for redevelopment.{The {Croft}is a good and popular place for physical activity. We play cricket, football and rounders on it. Also on {The Croft}there is a little play area with a slide, climbing frame and a couple of swings suitable for young children. I think{The Croft}is good because it is near the town centre and there is a large expanse of grass for playing on when your mum is shopping.
